channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: PULSE DJ Night Offers Fresh Sonic Experience
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 7:00 PM - People Using Live Software and Electronics (PULSE) is a forum for Rensselaer students interested in producing live audio by experimenting with musical hardware and digital audio workstations (DAWs). Join PULSE for an original DJ set of fresh compositions and remixes created by the PULSE crew…no RSVP needed!
item.author: Students

item.title: Check Out ASCE Game Night!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - ASCE student chapter offers a night to relax and have fun before finals, so come join fellow CEE students for an evening of pizza, fellowship, and games! Also, feel free to bring your favorite board game to share.
item.author: Students

item.title: RPI Bicentennial Holiday Concert, Victorian Stroll Kick-Off Scheduled for December 7
item.description: Date: Saturday, December 7, 2024 7:00 PM - Join us for this Bicentennial celebration, in partnership with the Rensselaer County Regional Chamber of Commerce, that kicks off the Troy Victorian Stroll! The Bicentennial Holiday Concert will feature performances by the Rensselaer Orchestra, Concert Choir, and Wind Symphony, and will include works by Brahms, Holst, Thorvaldsdottir, Wagner, and Borodin.
item.author: Community

item.title: MANE Schedules Final Research Poster Presentations
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM - Please join MANE on the second-floor lobby of the JEC to help the department celebrate its December 2024 M. Eng. graduates, and to learn about their research accomplishments!
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Host Information Session December 13
item.description: Date: Friday, December 13, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates, and describes how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: Dave Bebb to Lead December 14 EMPAC Tour
item.description: Date: Saturday, December 14, 2024 11:00 AM - Join Senior Network Administrator Dave Bebb and tour EMPAC’s advanced capabilities from an information technology perspective! With miles of fiber optic cable linking all four venues as well as the audio and video recording facilities, EMPAC is a phenomenal environment where physical and digital worlds seamlessly intersect on a human scale. There’s always something new to learn and discover!
item.author: Community

item.title: The Music Program in Department of Arts, HASS to Present Winter Sounds Festival 2024
item.description: Date: Sunday, December 8, 2024 12:30 PM - 4:00 PM - Enjoy an afternoon of music both new and old featuring the artistry and creativity of students in the RPI Music Program! Events are free and open to public, with a limited seating availability.
item.author: Community

item.title: Arts Department to Present 2024 Graduate Arts Open Studios on December 6
item.description: KS Brewer, Alex Cohen, Natan Diacon-Furtado, Allison Leigh Holt, Nina Isabelle, DJ Rekha, Hans Tursack, and Allie E.S. Wist will address such topics as humans as processes nested within processes; death and decay; the self-affirming rhetoric of AI intellectuals; embodied algorithms; the art and science of patterns; and the DJ as a catalyst for flow. This event is free to the public and all are welcome; don’t miss this one-day showcase of doctoral student research and studio practice!
item.author: Community

item.title: 2024 United Way Pledge Campaign Now Open
item.description:
Date: Friday, October 18, 2024 12:00 AM - Mon , December 16, 2024 12:00 AM - The United Way of the Greater Capital Region works to advance the common good by focusing on basic needs, family support and financial stability, and Rensselaer has long been an active and proud partner in helping to create long-lasting systemic change toward a better tomorrow. Once again, Rensselaer’s United Way volunteers call upon the generosity of the campus community to help address societal challenges.
